metadata.title: CVE-2016-2821 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the mozilla::dom::Element class in MozillaFirefox before 47.0 and Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.2, when contenteditablemode is enabled, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or causea denial of service (heap memory corruption) by triggering deletion of DOMelements that were created in the editor.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2821` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
